intro: Smithanthe rhodochelia subsp. philippinensis, commonly known as the Philippine star orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the Philippines. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its intricate, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in shaded, humid environments, often in mountainous regions with rich, well-drained soil. Its flowers are usually white or pale pink, with a distinct central column and showy sepals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
